title: Ticket #6653: Fix build on Mac OS 10.13 High Sierra
description:
In macOS 10.13 (High Sierra), the default version of libssl and libcrypto was changed from OpenSSL 0.9.8zh to LibreSSL 2.2.7. The older libraries are still available, but still no header files. The main effect on HTCondor is that VOMS uses some old ssleay functions that have been removed from LibreSSL (ASN1_verify(), ASN1_sign(), ASN1_digest()). Oddly, the VOMS and HTCondor code still builds and links, and the HTCondor binaries run fine. But the Python bindings fail when dlopen()ing libcondor_utils, due to the missing symbols.

The newest VOMS code still uses these old functions that aren't in LibreSSL, and VOMS doesn't appear to be under active development anymore. These old functions should be replaceable by newer functions in the API, but I'm having trouble finding documentation. For example, EVP_Digest() appears to be suitable replacement for ASN1_digest(), but the parameters are different.

A few options:

  • Continuing using the crusty OpenSSL 0.9.8 on macOS.
  • Drop VOMS support on macOS.
  • Figure out how to patch VOMS to replace the old ssl functions.
remarks:
2018-Apr-17 15:55:52 by jfrey:
I figured out why the linking and running succeed when the openssl functions are missing. The voms build script passes -undefined dynamic_lookup to the linker when creating the voms dynamic library. So everything compiles and runs without the symbols. But the process will explode if it tries to call one of them.

2018-May-03 10:59:24 by jfrey:
All versions of macOS will continue to use OpenSSL 0.9.8 in the 8.6.x series. On macOS 10.13 and above, we will directly link with the "out-of-date" 0.9.8 libraries in /usr/lib. A switch to LibreSSL may happen in 8.7 (#6668).

2018-May-04 13:24:24 by tim:
CODE REVIEW: Changes look good and are concise.

2018-May-04 13:24:48 by tim:
DOC REVIEW: No docs needed
